Kkk, fiquei meio decepcionado...

encontrei esse jogo depois de ficar procurando promoções na minha lista de desejos, e me deparando com o game "Kero Blaster". Estava interessado em comprar o game mas tinha visto uma anásile dizendo que era uma continuação de outro game chamado "Pink Hour"(que na verdade é um spin-off) e aí fui procurar esse jogo e vi que era gratuito, aí fiquei ansioso pra jogar, e baixei. Passei 30 minutos ansiso pra jogar e aí zerei em 10 minutos(pois esse jogo na verdade é uma prévia do que o Kero Blaster é), sendo que ainda morri algumas vezes pela dificuldade desse game, que se assemelha muito a games dos anos 80 e 90.

Tem graficos simples, muito antigos, mas são gráficos lindos e clássicos que eu amo demais, tanto que a maioria dos games que jogo são 2D pixelado. Jogabilidade simples, estórinha(se acha que estou escrevendo errado, é melhor parar de faltar a escola e ver umas aulinhas de português, xD) irônica, e é um verdadeiro "run'n gun". Agora depois de zera-lo, com certeza vou comprar o Kero Blaster para ter a experiência completa!

36557273.review:
Copié-collé de mon évaluation de Kero Blaster :

Après avoir fini le jeu une première fois (en mode normal) et l'avoir laissé de côté quelques temps, j'ai eu envie de tester les deux "démos" (en fait, des jeux à part entière), [b]Pink Hour[/b] puis [b]Pink Heaven[/b] : deux jeux gratuits dispos sur steam et qui servent de "démo" à [b]Kero Blaster[/b] (même univers et type de jeu, mais il s'agit de niveaux "inédits"). Techniquement, ils se terminent chacun en 10 ou 15 minutes, sauf qu'après les avoir terminé une première fois on débloque (dans chaque jeu) un mode "hard". Les niveaux sont globalement semblables mais bien plus accès sur les phases de plate-forme, c'est effectivement bien plus dur que le mode normal mais on se rend compte assez vite qu'on apprend à maîtriser un peu mieux les niveaux à chaque mort et c'est un plaisir de voir comme on finit par virevolter dans les premiers tableaux d'un niveau une fois qu'on a appris à les maitriser.

Et tout ça m'a donné envie de relancer [b]Kero Blaster[/b] en mode "Zangyou" (hard) aussi, juste pour voir. Et bien ça y est, je l'ai terminé ! J'en ai profité pour lancer un New Game + qui se torche très rapidement une fois qu'on connait bien le jeu (d'autant plus qu'on est suréquipé pendant une bonne partie du jeu) ; New Game + qui m'a permis au passage de me remettre les niveaux normaux en mémoire. Parce que oui, le NG+ c'est seulement pour le mode normal. 

Et donc : les niveaux en hard n'ont rien à voir avec les niveaux normaux. Si le mode de base du jeu est un genre de [i]run'n gun[/i], les niveaux du mode Zangyou sont beaucoup plus accès plate-forme (et beaucoup plus punitifs). Les boss sont relativement semblables dans l'ensemble (on note tout de même quelques différences) mais on a droit a un tout nouveau boss final, vraiment pas facile facile ! La difficulté principale des phases de plate-forme vient du fait que notre personnage a très peu d'air-control (et le double-saut, qu'on finit par débloquer, a tendance a compliquer encore plus tout ça), c'est parfois frustrant parce que c'est quelque chose d'assez inhabituel, mais on finit par maîtriser (relativement) la chose est c'est très satisfaisant de se rendre compte de nos progrès au fur et à mesure qu'on enchaîne les niveaux.
Cette progression est d'ailleurs très importante puisqu'on meurt souvent et que toutes les trois vies perdues, c'est le game over qui nous renvoie au début du niveau. Mais c'est bien comme ça qu'on se rend compte que tel passage difficile, qu'on avait enfin réussi à passer après 10 minutes d'essais improductifs, et bien maintenant on le passe les yeux fermés, et que du fait que l'on maîtrise ces difficultés, on peut maintenant traverser le niveau [U]beaucoup[/U] plus rapidement que les premières fois pour arriver au nouveau piège qui nous pose problème, et ainsi de suite.
Évidemment, l'ambiance et les musiques sont au rendez-vous ! Je me suis surpris à m'arrêter dans certains niveaux, juste pour écouter la musique !

En bref, j'avais vraiment apprécié le jeu la première fois que je l'ai terminé, mais il me semblait un peu trop "simpliste", un peu court, et dans l'ensemble assez loin d'égaler le souvenir que j'avais gardé de Cave Story (pour le comparer à un jeu du même dév'). Refaire Kero Blaster (et ses deux "démos", Pink Hour et Pink Heaven que je recommande vraiment, encore une fois) en mode hard m'a permis de l'apprécier autrement et je trouve finalement que c'est un très bon jeu qui transpire l'amour du détail et du level design bien pensé ! [u][b]Un gros coup de cœur pour moi ![/b][/u]

32666939.review:
i'm sorry, but retro-nes is not an excuse for garbage game design
i know this is just a f2p promo for another game which i admittedly have not played
but do not bother downloading this game, it is garbage, why did people spend time making this
it's almost cool, which is the really infuriating thing about it
but the game design of this tiny little piece of video game is fucking atrocious
why would you make the default controls the god damn arrow keys, are you an elementary school student in 1999
and why would you make a game that is not a platformer have jumps that you can miss by just failing to hold down the jump button, there's no skill reward there, just punishment for not paying too much attention to your stupid control scheme
i love difficult games, and this is not one, but it has a few game design pitfalls which create an illusion of difficulty which is in no way rewarding, which is one of the worst possible things i could say about a game
it's like all the shitty frustrating aspects of mario and megaman, without any of the fun interesting parts of either one
to elaborate, the fun part of mario was the skill based platforming, the elegant movement scheme that allowed you to just fly through the game if you were a true master at it's simple yet deep movement
and the fun part of megaman was the skill based combat, with just enough platforming to make the movement important, but mostly you wanted to get to the boss fights, which functioned as a perfect climax to the interest curve of a well designed level
in this game, the platforming is fucking stupid, and you can literally just skip the boss fight by jumping over him
not beat the boss but jumping over him like in mario, but skip it, with none of the satisfaction of beating it, with one incredibly easy jump
i don't write many reviews, but this was pathetic and stupid enough that i felt compelled to kick it, partially because most of the other reviews are positive, so i can at least be a minority dissenting voice
and the pathetic attempt to directly promote kero blaster at the very end was frankly repulsive

for the record, kero blaster might be awesome, i have no idea, but i will never try it because this game sucked that bad

29524605.review:
Super cute little platforming run-n-gun game. It only provides a single stage (plus a modified version for Hard Mode, which is unlocked after completing the normal mode), but it's worth checking out nevertheless. 

The platforming is nice and tight, and the movement/firing mechanics are very cool. If you're on the fence about Kero Blaster, this should give you a good idea of if you'll like it.

What I found cool about Pink Hour is that you can complete the game, both in Normal and Hard Mode, without firing your projectile at enemies. You can actually complete it without damaging any enemies at all, including the boss. I think that shows a certain level of care and detail that was considered when making what comes down to what is essentially a demo. 

Highly recommend this, for people who haven't played Kero Blaster, have played Kero Blaster, or anyone ever, basically. Very cute, very fun. Worth a look for sure.

26496885.review:
A lovely 10 minutes, literally, 2D platformer game.

A mini spin-off to [b]Kero Blaster[/b], you play as a pink dude (I don't think he has a name..) whom forgot a document meant for the President in the company he's working for. For some reason, the document is located in an underground cave and there you go jumping spikes and shooting pink lasers. 

The game is really short where you didn't even have to kill enemies to proceed, even the boss are skippable if you can get pass him, according to an older review. After completing the game, there's a short advert for their other games and Hard mode will be unlocked.

Basically, that's it and since it only takes 10 minutes to complete and has a pretty charming aesthetic, it's a no-brainer for a recommendation. 

[h1]4 / 5[/h1]

(English)
Pink Hour - short and free promo action to the game Kera Blaster.

We play for the unknown pink stuff female, where the boss gave a task to get your lost office document. This document, we need to find why it is in the cave with all sorts of bugs and thorns. (Русский)
Розовый час - короткие и бесплатные акции для игры Кера бластер.

Мы играем за неизвестного розовые вещи женщина, где босс дал задание, чтобы получить утерянный документ Office. Этот документ, нужно выяснить, почему он находится в пещере со всевозможными жучками и шипы. Игра буквально на 5 минут, если вы хотите увидеть все концовки, а их-то 3 - 15. Окончаний, соответственно, получаемых за прохождение, прохождения в сложном режиме, и за потерю документа. Игра обладает приятной пиксельной графикой и приятной мелодией. Минус - есть ошибка при включении игры на экране появляется сплошной синий, а эта фигня не лечится, у меня он пропал только при запуске на другой машине.

В целом, это легко (даже в жестком режиме), мед, короткая игра. Не шедевр, но сходить во время перерыва на чай. 5/10

23112962.review:
我今天翻Steam的时候找到的两个免费游戏:Pink Hour和Pink Heaven。本着反正不要钱干嘛不去玩的想法花了一个小时不到通关了两款游戏。
好玩的，真的是好玩的。
因为本来游戏流程就短所以也没什么好写的，所以我就干脆两个游戏只写一篇评测发两遍就好了（其实是懒）。
2D像素横板过关向的小游戏，键位可改，有惯性系统，虽然短但还是很精致的。游戏有两个语种（日语和英语，没有中文，但是英语难度还好）、两个结局，一周目获得HE（Happy Ending）的话可以开启Hard模式，二周目Hard模式通关有TE（True Ending）。
然后下面是一周目分支要素，想要自己尝试一下的各位就不要手都点开啦。（其实一周目流程很短，难度也不高，所以推荐自己摸索。）
[spoiler]拿到重要文件后，收到伤害（掉落悬崖直接死亡不算，别问我怎么知道的）会导致文件损坏，变成NE（Normal Ending）。所以HE只需要后期无伤就OK。[/spoiler]
HE和NE的结局都是非常的可爱！都值得一看的！
强烈安利有空的各位去玩！

来自被萌翻的Delmore
2016.5.21

20913904.review:
Ну что же, наконец-то я прошел эту мини-игру на хард моде, и посему достоин написать свой обзор. Игра, а если быть более точным - мини-игра, представляет собой небольшую рекламу для полноценной игры Kero Blaster. Но мой взгляд, это можно назвать одним из гениальнейших ходов маркетологов! В ней вам покажут основы геймплея подобных игр и заставят пустить ностальгическую слезу по тем временам, когда в ходу была такая замечательная игровая приставка Денди, а также с пеной у рта бежать и покупать Kero Blaster (^^). Сюжет несмотря на свою простоту обладает 3 концовками, саундтрек, как и положенно замечательным пиксельным играм, потрясающ (опять же несмотря на кажущуюся простоту), ну а открывающийся после прохождения hard mode действительно заставит вас понервничать, даже толика юмора имеется. В общем в этом промо есть все для полноценного продолжения. Искренне надеюсь, что Розовый Час не оставят только в роли промо-акции и со временем она перерастет в замечательную пиксельную игру.
А пока ставлю 9 розовых комочков из 10, с надеждой на продолжение:)

20072533.review:
The Pink Hour is a short, free, promo game associated to Kero Blaster (Available on Steam).

It's a very simple platformer that should only take a few minutes to play. You play as an office worker who realizes her documents have been misplaced.... In a cave for some reason. A quick journey and a simple boss fight later, you either return to your office with the paper work, pleasing your boss (and getting to leave on time) OR if the document gets damaged, you have to work late.  :-(

It even has a cute epilogue, which can unlock a harder version of the cave with it's own ending.

The first time I played this game, my brain said "This feels like Cave Story". I hadn't realized this was also made by Daisuke Amaya AKA Pixel, who created Cave Story.

So if you enjoy side scroll platformers, give this a try. If you like it, consider Kero Blaster.

Ситуация ровно таже, что и с ее продолжением Pink Heaven (ссылка на обзор внизу). Позабавило, что рекламируемая в конце обеих игр Kero Blaster вышла позже обеих в ноябре 2015. Даже бесстыже открывают ссылку в браузере прямо на нее в обоих случаях, четко запланировали все наперед. Будто не хватает рекламки прямо внизу рядом с жизнями на протяжении всей игры. Поэтому вне всяких сомнений, Pink Hour и Pink Heaven своеобразные рекламные подобия демоигр. Можно допустить зачем тогда сразу две подобных игры? Допущу, и получится, что в лучшем случае эти игры были просто сделаны сами по себе как маленькие простецкие истории, но тут им выдалось предназначение свыше прорекламировать другую платную игру от своего же создателя, но более крупную по объему и полноценную (нет, на самом деле не так, ведь реклама платной игры является частью игры и даже неожиданным обновлением врядли так дополнишь).

19800182.review:
I'm kind of torn on this one. I originally played the first release of this, which only came in the Hard Mode flavor; meaning that the game you start with now is actually [b]severely[/b] toned down in difficulty from what it originally was. And toned down, it's a cute, serviceable little preview romp for Kero Blaster. I'd recommend it, sure.

The problem is that the formerly mandated Hard Mode (which you can still unlock by beating this on easy) is absolute screaming horseshit on toast. It's an agonizingly precision-based platformer over a series of instant death pits with Ninja Gaiden style bats flying in your face, and a player character that controls with ten times more inertia than is appropriate for this setup. I cannot make it past the first screen. This having been my first impression when it came out, it absolutely DESTROYED any and all interest I had in trying Kero Blaster, which I was previously reasonably hyped for. The lives system only makes it even worse.

So, go ahead and try it I guess, but don't expect anything good to come of Hard Mode.

19402915.review:
Now, I'm not necessarily a fan of action-adventure platformers or games with pixel graphics, but there was something about the original release of Cave Story that entranced me. Studio Pixel crafted a wonderful little game worth playing over and over again, and it's a gaming classic to me. 

But this is a review for Pink Hour, not Cave Story. That game will get its turn eventually, but let me start of by saying Daisuke Amaya (otherwise known as Pixel) hasn't lost his touch for game design. Similar graphics, similar musical style, similar gameplay...This feels like a tech demo for another big project of Pixel's (and from what I hear, it is). But for someone who hasn't played any of Pixel's games, is it worth checking out?

Well, I feel this kind of game best fits the kind of crowd who likes run-and-gun platforming, and doesn't mind the old-school aesthetic. The game is fair enough to make it through in one shot, unless you're completely inept at platforming/dodging obstacles. If there's one complaint I can make, it's that you can't change the direction of your projectiles while holding the fire button. Cave Story didn't have this problem, so it took me a while to get used to this change.

In short, I'd say this is worth playing at least once. If you're looking for something meatier (and have some extra cash to blow off), I'd say play Cave Story afterwards. It's free, so what are you waiting for?

19115638.review:
Розовый Час - короткий и бесплатный промо экшн к игре Kera Blaster.

Играем мы за розовую неведомую фигню женского пола, которой шеф дал задание надыбать потерянный офисный документ. Документ сей, нам надо найти почему то в пещере со всякими жуками и шипами. Игра проходится буквально минут за 5, если хотите увидеть все концовки, а их тут 3 - то за 15. Концовки соответственно получаем за прохождение, за прохождение в сложном режими, и за потерю документа. В игре симпатичная пиксельная графика и приятная мелодия. Минус - есть баг, при включении игры экран может отображаться сплошным синим, причем эта фигня не лечится, у меня он исчез только при запуске на другой машине.

В целом эта легкая (даже в сложном режиме), милая, короткая игра. Не шедевр, но пройти во время перерыва на чай, можно.
6 из 10.

18945226.review:
When the game ended I was like [i]that's it?[/i]. Considering it's free, I felt I got what I "paid" for, and more. This game is so, so much more than "just a simple platformer":

[list]
[*] good gameplay: if you ever die in this game (and you will), you never feel it's the game's fault, the controls are on point and precise. If you die, it's because you fucked up, and still is very easy to die.
[*] mechanics: are there even any? It's just run and gun; not quite Mega Man, but still very solid.
[*] branching paths and different endings: choose well.
[*] great story: fantastical yes, but still very good.

And when they said [b]hard mode[/b]... oh boy, it was hard.

If this game has any cons at all, it would be that it is way too damn short, but it's free. I'll try to get Kero Blaster if it looks and plays anything like the Pink series.

Is very cute tho.

18737629.review:
Pink Hour is simple and short, and considering that it's free, it's worth at least checking out. It's a typical 2D platformer. You can shoot and move and dodge obstacles and all that. The story is pretty silly, but cute. You play as Pink, an office worker, who must obtain a document for her boss in one piece. It's located underground, for some reason, and she can blast enemies, somehow. You gotta roll with it.

The difficulty is pretty simple, so it's not a particularly stressful endeavor, and a fair amount of people are going to beat this on their first go. The graphics are simple and pixelated, and not particularly bad, though not the neatest looking either. There's only one boss fight, but funnily enough, you can skip it if you jump far enough and at the right time to go over its head. There's two different endings you can get here; one for bringing the document back, and one for beating the game without it (if you get damaged, for example). The ending for beating it with the document gives you a short cutscene, leading to the store page for Kero Blaster, which is a nice way to promote your game (since this is an advertisement for the game, after all).

There's a hard mode you can unlock if you beat the game, which extends its replayability just a little bit. Because I'm not the best at video games, this took me a lot longer than it probably should have, but it's still pretty beatable in under an hour. What makes the mode so hard is that Pink (the character you control) tends to float when she jumps, which can make it easy to over or underaim when you jump. This isn't bad in the regular mode, but in hard mode, some platforms are only barely big enough to where you have to jump perfectly. I'm not particularly a fan of the "perfect jump" difficulty in games, so a good portion of the hard mode wasn't too fun, and the second-to-last screen right after the boss fight took up maybe the most time on my hard mode attempts. However, once you figure it out, you'll be able to get the rhythm down and blow through it pretty fast. There's an ending to unlock here if you beat it with the document, leading into either Kero Blaster or Pink Heaven.

The game is fun for the short amount of time it offers, and while I'm not a fan of the jumping, the game isn't punishing and doesn't want to be arbitrarily hard. It's a nice relaxing time overall. Also, it's free, so there's no stress over cost per playtime. The one downside for some people may be that there are no achievements or trading cards, but this isn't a loss in my book, considering how straightforward the game is. Give it a go!

This game is a free platformer made by Pixel (the guy who made cave Cave Story).

The normal mode can be beaten in less than ten minutes, assuming you don't lose the document by getting hit after obtaining it, but the ending is worth it with some fourth wall breaking and some references to other japanese indie games.

After beating normal mode, you get hard mode, which completely changes the layout of the stage and add a new boss pattern. In hard mode you'll get frustrated a little for missing a jump due to floaty controls, but I beat it on second try, so it's not that hard if you have some experience with the genre.

If you manage to beat hard mode you'll get a completely new ending that ties this game to another one called Pink Heaven, which comes out next week, according to some forum poster.

All in all, if you have half an hour free, my verdict is go for it and have fun.

18732679.review:
Pink Hour can be beaten in about 8 minutes, so there is no need to ramble on with a long review. It acts as a demo to Studio Pixel's "Kero Blaster." That game is a follow-up to the 2004 hit "Cave Story" by Daisuke Pixel.

This is, essentially, a really quick level that gets you to grips with the controls. You jump and shoot. You can shoot up and once shooting, you can move backwards without changing aim. What makes this demo worth playing a few times are the unlockables.

In addition to an alternate ending, there is also a hard mode. Beating that sets up where Pink ends up in her own sequel, "Pink Heaven." That is coming to Steam within a week, as well.

The game plays smoothly and offers some great incentives for dedicated gamers. It may not be excruciatingly difficult or life affirming, but the game is nice, short and sweet. That it's free is pretty much a "why not?"

Just give it a try. If you don't like it, so be it.

8/10

Очень коротенькая демка выходящей 11 ноября игрушки Kero Blaster. Из того, что получается увидеть за 7-10 минут, а именно столько займет прохождение Pink Hour, нас ждет довольно интересный и неплохой платформер. Управление в нем отзывчивое, и напоминает Super Mario Bros.,графика в стилизации под 8-битные платформы, звук... есть, в общем! Из минусов - ну уж очень малая продолжительность, да и честно говоря подутомили все эти ретро-пиксели. 
Что получится в полной игре узнаем же 11 ноября.
Рейтинг ожидания - 75%

18730005.review: There isn't too terribly much to talk about here with this one: if you've played Kero Blaster, this is more or less the length of  half a level in Kero Blaster. It's also just as good as half a level in Kero Blaster, so there's no real disappointment there. This game does have multiple endings which aren't too much of a bother to unlock, considering that a playthrough of this will last about 10 minutes. There aren't any upgrades, but there is a hard mode which changes the level quite a bit. My only complaint about Hard Mode is that the first screen is easily the hardest in the game, and the ones that follow are a lot more lenient. Still though, I managed to complete the game about five times over the course of the 30 minutes or so that I played. Nothing terribly amazing, but it's a good bit of fun for free. Check it out if you're a fan of Kero Blaster or are just looking to see what Kero Blaster is all about.

Short but very entertaining and fun! Plus, the little pink guy is so cute:) I hope they release a longer version of the game cause I very much enjoyed it:D
Pink Hour is an amusing free platformer released as a "demo" of sorts for an upcoming game by the same company, Kero Blaster. It provides a good half hour of fun, or ten minutes of fun followed by a half hour of ragequitting, depending on how good you are at platformers.

Honestly, it's a pretty well put together platform/shooting game, with the biggest "drawback" being that it's fairly short - something that would be resolved by buying the game it's promoting, obviously. The only real issue I had was that Hard showed that it might have some issues with precision jumping, as I found myself falling short or overshooting on those segments reliably, which was annoying in this short level and would be more annoying if I had to do it constantly in Kero Blaster.

That said, though, it was a good half hour of fun for me, and free, so I can't really help but give this a thumbs-up.

哈哈哈，这种童年风格简直不能停

但是风格很迥异啊    2333   完全可以当做消遣用，主要是即使这样，也觉得很萌啊。(・ω・=)对话啊什么的。

好期待广告的那款作品。希望能在圣诞打折~~买买买。这是信仰      背景音乐也很怀旧。语言只有两种，日语与英语

你有3条命（简直是超级马里奥）只有两点血，打植物什么的会有几率掉红心

第一遍非常的简单，选的英语，这里的英语真的非常易懂，初中水平就能理解。为了铺垫Kero Blaster的上市也是努力了，包括对隐藏地点的诱导，操作什么的。

找到【the important document】即是丢失的重要物品之后要保证文件不被水滴弄湿，被怪物弄坏。否则即使打败了boss也还是任务失败哦~Σ( ° △ °|||)︴ 

第一遍过关之后故事也是暂时结束了，进入困难模式。我只想说这个困难模式像超级玛丽哈哈哈简直了

18725871.review:
This is actually a demo for an upcoming game known as Kero Blaster. Pink Hour stars one of the side characters where you have to retrieve a document and give it to the president of some company you work for. It's a very simple and cute story and the pixel art I would describe as the same. The game itself is very simple as you can finish it under 10 minutes but when you unlock hard mode that is when the game becomes more interesting. 

I don't know how the full game is actually gonna be as I write this but I can tell you this demo definitely deserves a look if you're interested at all. It's a fun and free 2D platformer and you can't go wrong with that. And it's very cute so that's a plus for me. ^_^ I give it a 7/10
